instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7052: What is R7052? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7022: What is R7022? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not recognizing battery
threads.message:
in system it show not installed, no orange light, not running from battery alone.
Checked the usual suspects <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR> - <RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR> - <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR> - <RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR> all seems fine, a bit stucked at this point.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not recognizing battery
threads.message: Disconnect BIL and try again, also could be bad ISL or bad SMC, all this assuming you already tried other known good battery

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not recognizing battery
threads.message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 12270"]Disconnect BIL and try again, also could be bad ISL or bad SMC, all this assuming you already tried other known good battery[/QUOTE]

What is BIL?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not recognizing battery
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not recognizing battery
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 12312"]Battery indicator. [/QUOTE]

does the same withot the BIL also replaced the ISL and stil no result though it does run on battery only if i disconnect the battery and connect the magsafe so fan spinning and reconnect the battery and disconnet the magsafe..when I do that and boot to system no battery installed messege, then disconnect magsafe the computer goes to sleep mode kinda getting dimmed to black screen fan spinning for aprox 1.5 min and fan stoppes.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not recognizing battery
threads.message: update: on SMC mode it runs on battery without problems, should of checked it before I guess..SMC?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not recognizing battery
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A not recognizing battery
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 12339"]Dead SMC...[/QUOTE]

not that dead but battery recognition part is definitely dead.
